page.title: 10HEDGEROWS AND FIELD NAMES
page.content: About 7\ kilometres of hedgerow have disappeared from our block compared with the 1950 maps, and possibly many more have gone that we did not notice. Valuable habitats have gone, but that isn't the only loss. We asked farmers whether their fields have names. Most have names like{20 acre}or{22 acre. Interesting old names just disappear as fields are amalgamated. { Pingles, Cold Oates}and{Great Ground seem to be very old names.{Danes Hill} is on high ground: it is thought the Saxons used it as a lookout for Danes. {Poison Field}is where dead cattle were buried in quicklime after an outbreak of anthrax.{Hovel Field}has an old cattle shed or "hovel" in it.{Laud's {Meadow}may get its name because it is very fertile and worthy of praise. Bombs fell in{Bomb Holes}during the war.{Conservation}has an SSSI in it!
